results.title: Better ways. 4. One man and his job
results.creator_credit: Denis Ward, British Productivity Council and Peter Morley
results.brief_description: Shows application of Work Study methods. The main example is the assembly of governor elements for diesel fuel injection pumps. Reveals how a job is analysed on a two-handed chart. The film digresses to demonstrate the principles of Motion Economy shown under laboratory conditions at the Work Study School of the College of Aeronautics. The film shows how special fixtures and bench designs were fashioned, and the worker trained in the new methods. Stresses that the human factor must always be understood in Work Study.

results.title: Better typing at your fingertips
results.brief_description: Typewriting champion, Norman Saksvig, and two of his girl students demonstrate common typing mistakes, including bad habits sometimes acquired at school. First, the faulty technique is shown, then in each case correct methods. Close-ups and slow motion studies accent the instruction. No other credits available.

results.title: Better than any sport
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “The Boss Class”.
This film shows how up-to-date British managers achieve their objectives. Typical management problems are explained by case histories - exporting and takeovers by the Leyland Group (Sir Donald Stokes), Marks and Spencer’s philosophy of marketing, and then a small manufacturer (Jim Houston) talks of his experience with a new highly technological product.

group_siblings.title: People are the main part of any deal

results.title: Better seeds for better grasslands
results.brief_description: This film shows how researchers and seed-growers combine their efforts to raise output from grasslands. In the laboratories, strains of alfalfa, clover and other fodder crops are bred which are more resistant to disease, and more nutritious. Rigorous dampness tests, etc., eliminate all but the hardiest plants, which are then multiplied on specialist seed-farms, carefully inspected to ensure purity of the resulting seed. Reveals many other aspects of scientific farming. No other credits available.

results.title: Better safe than sorry
results.brief_description: This film depicts situations that children could encounter with strangers, as well as with known adults, that involve physical and sexual abuse and shows children how to deal with these potential situations. Stresses that children are in no way to blame for the deviant behaviour of adults and should not feel guilty about their involvemenmt in these situations. Presents three rules for children to follow: SAY NO, GET AWAY, TELL SOMEONE. Suitable for Mid Primary-Upper Secondary level students. No other credits available.

results.title: Better reading
results.brief_description: Illustrates examples of poor reading habits and shows how these may be overcome by adopting corrective reading methods. The film illustrates the case of an intelligent high school student whose work suffers from his slow reading habits. The student attends a mobile reading clinic where he undertakes a course in reading improvement designed to improve his vocabulary, increase his understanding, and speed up his reading techniques.

results.title: Better dairying
results.brief_description: Produced for Cyclone fencing, this film looks at the value of tubular steel and wire mesh in farm buildings, fencing and gates on dairy farms, especially the savings in labour and maintenance costs. The uses of steel fencing and prefabricated steel sheds are described, followed by a complete milking unit in operation. The film closes with an analysis of capital costs, savings and earnings from increased yields.

results.title: Better business letters
results.brief_description: A training video with an accompanying trainers manual designed to teach better letter writing techniques for business. A number of techniques are covered along with tips on writing clearly and persuasively. The video also points out common misuses of words and expressions and offers several methods for getting letters started.
